p: On admission, the body temperature 37.2 Â°C, pulse 107 bpm, breathing 20/min, blood pressure 175/108 mmHg, intermittent mild disturbance of consciousness, and with visible scattered red blister rash in the left eyelid and left forehead, which was protruded and tender, but otherwise with normal superficial lymph nodes and cardiopulmonary examinations. Nervous system examination showed negative Pap's sign but normal muscle tension in limbs.
